speaker: portraitlady
dialog: Wait is that it? God, what a bummer, right?

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: Oh! I didn't mean to startle you. I was just over reading that conversation. But would you like my advice?

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: Yes...? No...? I’ll take your silence as yes. You’ll need my advice, trust me.

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: What you said? Really not that bad.

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: I mean, yeah, whatever. They don't like to talk about it. But they shouldn't drill you this hard.

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: It’s not like you were trying to embarass them or anything. And it wasn’t even a secret! Honestly, they’re being a little TOO sensitive about it.

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: Just tell them if they acted poorly in the past, they should be able to live with that. And that you didn’t mean to offend them in the first place.

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: There’s no reason they should be mad at all. That’s what I think at least.

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: They can play victim all they want, but we both know you’re in the right.

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: Well, that’s about all the time I can dedicate myself into caring about this. Hope you make the right decision here.

speaker: portraitlady
dialog: Also, don’t worry who I am. People take information from people they don’t know all the time.
